  "article_text": [
    "in the realm of ordinary differential equations in the complex domain , briot and bouquet studied the differential equations of the form @xmath0 where  @xmath1 and  @xmath2 are holomorphic functions vanishing at the origin and without common factors .",
    "they gave conditions guaranteeing the existence of holomorphic solutions  @xmath3 such that  @xmath4  @xcite .",
    "the problem of briot and bouquet can be stated , more generally , as the problem of existence of curves  @xmath5 that are tangent to the foliation generated by the one - form @xmath6 with the original problem corresponding to curves of the form  @xmath7 . a definitive solution to the problem of briot and bouquet",
    "was given by camacho and sad  @xcite , who proved the existence of invariant curves for every foliation of the form  ( [ bb ] ) .",
    "the theorem of camacho and sad motivated the quest for extensions of their result to other ambient spaces and foliations by leaves of other dimensions .    for foliations defined in normal complex analytic spaces of dimension two , camacho proved that a separatrix through a singular point  @xmath8 exists if the dual graph of the exceptional divisor of a resolution of  @xmath8 is a tree  @xcite . in the same article ,",
    "camacho exhibited foliations without separatrices in germs of singular analytic surfaces .",
    "in contrast to the situation in  @xmath9 , not every foliation on a singular analytic surface is locally induced by a vector field , so we may ask the following question , attributed to gmez - mont : _ does a vector field in a singular surface have a separatrix passing through the singular point ? _    natural examples answering negatively this question arise from holomorphic vector fields on _ intermediate kato surfaces_. kato surfaces are non - singular compact complex surfaces ; they are minimal , non - khler and belong to the class  @xmath10 in the enriques - kodaira classification .",
    "they were introduced by kato  @xcite and , among them , we find _ intermediate _ ones  @xcite .",
    "intermediate kato surfaces have a divisor  @xmath11 ( the maximal reduced divisor of rational curves ) having connected support and a negative - definite intersection form .",
    "some of these admit a holomorphic vector field  @xmath12 . by the negative - definiteness of its intersection form , @xmath11",
    "is preserved by  @xmath12 .",
    "these vector fields are well - understood and we know that , close to  @xmath11 , there are no singularities of  @xmath12 off  @xmath11 and that any germ of curve invariant by the vector field is contained in  @xmath11  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* lemme  2.2 ) .",
    "hence , when contracting  @xmath11 to a point  @xmath8 , we obtain a two - dimensional complex analytic space endowed with a holomorphic vector field having an isolated equilibrium point at  @xmath8 which _ does not _ have a separatrix .",
    "( by the compactness of the space , this vector field is complete ) .",
    "+ these examples of vector fields without separatrices in complex analytic spaces of dimension two are unique within the class of vector fields in _ compact _ ones ( it is probably easy to deduce this from the classification of holomorphic vector fields on compact complex surfaces  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* thm .  0.3 ) ) .",
    "our main result affirms that they are also unique within the larger class of _ complete _ vector fields :    let  @xmath13 be a connected , normal , irreducible , complex , two - dimensional analytic space with a singularity at  @xmath14 and let  @xmath12 be a complete holomorphic vector field on  @xmath13 . if the foliation induced by  @xmath12 has no separatrix through  @xmath8 , the minimal resolution of  @xmath13 at  @xmath8 is a kato surface .",
    "we stress the fact that the only global assumption on the surface is the completeness of the vector field and that the compactness of  @xmath13 is a consequence of our result .",
    "it also implies that  @xmath8 is the only singular point of  @xmath13 and that  @xmath8 is an isolated equilibrium point of  @xmath12 .",
    "theorem  a guarantees the existence of separatrices for complete vector fields on two - dimensional analytic spaces which are , for example , not compact . for stein spaces ,",
    "this result can be strengthened :    let  @xmath13 be a normal , irreducible complex two - dimensional stein space and  @xmath12 a complete holomorphic vector field on  @xmath13 .",
    "let  @xmath8 be a singular point of  @xmath13 that is an isolated equilibrium point of  @xmath12 .",
    "either    * there are either one or two separatrices of  @xmath12 through  @xmath8 and  @xmath15 is a cyclic quotient singularity ; or * there is an infinite number of separatrices of  @xmath12 through  @xmath8 and  @xmath12 induces an action of  @xmath16 .",
    "the classification of holomorphic vector fields on compact complex surfaces was achieved by dloussky , oeljeklaus and toma in  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* thm .  0.3 ) . the last piece in this classification is given by vector fields in kato surfaces . the natural way in which kato surfaces appear in the proof of theorem  a will allow us to give an alternative proof of some parts of the classification of holomorphic vector fields on compact complex surfaces , as suggested by matei toma . in a relatively self - contained manner and without relying on the enriques - kodaira classification , we will , by borrowing some arguments from  @xcite , prove the following result :    let  @xmath12 be a non - trivial holomorphic vector field with zeros on the minimal compact complex surface  @xmath13 inducing an effective action of  @xmath17 .",
    "at least one of the following holds :    1 .",
    "@xmath13 is rational or ruled . 2 .",
    "@xmath12 has a first integral .",
    "3 .   there is an effective divisor  @xmath18 in  @xmath13 such that  @xmath19 .",
    "4 .   @xmath13 is a kato surface .",
    "our results are based in a local analysis of the vector field in a neighborhood of some invariant divisors of the surface ( the exceptional divisor of a resolution in theorems  a and  b , the maximal invariant divisor in theorem  c ) , where we use the notion of _ semicompleteness _ to exploit , locally , the completeness assumption on the vector field .",
    "we make extensive use of the `` bimeromorphic '' theory of semicomplete vector fields on surfaces developed jointly with rebelo in  @xcite .",
    "+ this article is organized as follows . in section  [ sec - localmodels ]",
    "we will recall some standard facts about vector fields and foliations on complex surfaces and analytic spaces ( the reader is however supposed to be familiar , for example , with the material discussed in the first chapter of  @xcite and in  ( * ? ? ?",
    "we also discuss semicomplete vector fields on surfaces based mainly on  @xcite .",
    "section  [ sec - cycles ] describes the combinatorics of semicomplete vector fields in the neighborhood of divisors containing cycles .",
    "theorem  a will be proved in section  [ sec : kato ] .",
    "it relates the resolution of a singularity admitting a semicomplete vector field without separatrices to the construction of kato surfaces .",
    "theorems  b and  c will be respectively proved in sections  [ sec : stein ] and  [ sec : comp ] .",
    "+ the author heartily thanks patrick popescu - pampu , julio rebelo , jos seade , jawad snoussi , matei toma , meral tosun and the anonymous referee .",
    "let  @xmath13 be complex ( non - singular ) surface and @xmath12 a holomorphic vector field in  @xmath13 .",
    "around every point  @xmath20 in  @xmath13 , @xmath12 may be locally written as  @xmath21 where  @xmath1 is a holomorphic function and  @xmath22 is a holomorphic vector field with isolated singularities , well - defined up to multiplication by a non - vanishing holomorphic function .",
    "the locally defined vector field  @xmath22 defines a globally well - defined foliation  @xmath23 , _ the foliation induced by  @xmath12 _ , that will be denoted by  @xmath24 whenever we need to stress its relation to  @xmath12 .",
    "if  @xmath25 , we say that  @xmath8 is a _ regular _ point of  @xmath23 and we say that  @xmath8 is a _",
    "singularity _ of  @xmath23 otherwise .",
    "the foliation  @xmath23 is said to be _ reduced in seidenberg s sense _ if the linear part of  @xmath22 at a singularity  @xmath8 of  @xmath23 is non - nilpotent and , if it has two non - vanishing eigenvalues , if their ratio is not a positive rational .",
    "seidenberg s theorem affirms that every foliation may be brought , in a locally finite number of blowups , to one where every singularity is reduced ( see , for example , @xcite ) .",
    "we say that the curve  @xmath26 with reduced equation  @xmath2 is _",
    "invariant by  @xmath12 _ if  @xmath2 divides  @xmath27",
    ". moreover , if  @xmath28 and  @xmath2 divides  @xmath29 we say that  @xmath30 is _",
    "invariant by  @xmath23 _ ( if a curve is invariant by  @xmath23 it is also invariant by  @xmath12 but the converse need not be true ) . in this last case ,",
    "if  @xmath2 is irreducible and  @xmath31 with  @xmath2 and  @xmath32 relatively prime , we say that  @xmath33 is the _ order of  @xmath12 along  @xmath30 _ , and write  @xmath34 .",
    "if  @xmath35 is a compact curve invariant by  @xmath23 , its self - intersection can be calculated by means of the camacho - sad formula : for each singularity  @xmath36 , of  @xmath23 lying in  @xmath35 the _ camacho - sad _ index , @xmath37 , is defined and the camacho - sad formula yields @xmath38  @xcite .",
    "+ the vector field  @xmath12 endows the foliation  @xmath23 with a _ leafwise affine structure _ ( with singularities ) varying holomorphically in the transverse direction : every curve  @xmath30 invariant by  @xmath23 inherits from  @xmath12 an _ affine structure _ ( with singularities )  ( * ? ? ?",
    "8) . in the case where the vector field does not vanish along the curve ,",
    "the charts of this structure are given by the inverses of the local solutions of the vector field  @xcite .",
    "the affine structure affects every point  @xmath39 with a _ ramification index _",
    "@xmath40 ( * ? ? ?",
    "* def .  4 ) ,",
    "whose value is  @xmath41 except for a discrete ( with the plaque topology ) set of points in  @xmath30 , the _ singularities _ of the affine structure .",
    "if  @xmath35 is a compact curve invariant by  @xmath23 of euler characteristic  @xmath42 , we have , for the above indexes , the poincar - hopf relation  ( * ? ? ?",
    "5 ) : @xmath43    for vector fields , we have the following definition  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* def .  16 ) :    [ def : reduced ] a holomorphic vector field  @xmath12 on a surface  @xmath13 is said to be _ reduced _ if the induced foliation  @xmath24 is reduced in seidenberg s sense and if for every point  @xmath8 , the union of all the curves containing  @xmath8 that are invariant by  @xmath12 is a curve with normal crossings .",
    "a couple  @xmath44 of a holomorphic vector field  @xmath12 and a divisor  @xmath11 invariant by  @xmath12 is said to be _",
    "minimal good _ if  @xmath12 is reduced in a neighborhood of  @xmath11 , if every irreducible component of  @xmath11 is non - singular and if no exceptional curve of the first kind belonging to  @xmath11 may be collapsed while keeping  @xmath12 reduced and the corresponding divisor non - singular .",
    "every holomorphic vector field may be transformed , by a locally finite number of blowups , to a _ reduced _ one ( combine seidenberg s theorem with the resolution of embedded curves in surfaces ) .",
    "let  @xmath45 be a germ of irreducible , reduced , complex - analytic two - dimensional space . by a holomorphic vector field on  @xmath46 we mean ,",
    "indistinctly , either a derivation of the local ring  @xmath47 or , for an embedding  @xmath48 , the restriction to  @xmath49 of a holomorphic vector field in  @xmath50 tangent to  @xmath49 @xcite . by the following proposition ( obtained with the help of jawad snoussi ) ,",
    "a holomorphic vector field on  @xmath45 is also equivalent to a holomorphic vector field on a resolution .",
    "[ desing ] let  @xmath12 be a holomorphic vector field in the germ of two - dimensional irreducible analytic space  @xmath45 .",
    "let  @xmath51 be the minimal resolution .",
    "there exists a holomorphic vector field  @xmath52 in  @xmath53 such that  @xmath54 .",
    "zariski proved that a resolution of  @xmath45 may be obtained by alternating two procedures : normalization and the blowing up of singular points in normal surfaces ( see  @xcite for the algebraic case , @xcite for the analytic one ) . in order to prove the existence of a resolution where the preimage of the vector field extends holomorphically to the exceptional divisor",
    ", it suffices to show that these two procedures transform holomorphic vector fields into holomorphic ones .",
    "we begin with normalization .",
    "suppose , up to separating the irreducible components of  @xmath13 , that  @xmath13 is irreducible at  @xmath55 .",
    "let  @xmath56 be the local ring of holomorphic functions at  @xmath55 , @xmath57 its field of fractions and  @xmath58 the integral closure of  @xmath56 .",
    "let  @xmath59 be the derivation induced by  @xmath12 .",
    "this derivation extends to  @xmath60 . since  @xmath56 is a noetherian integral domain containing  @xmath61 , a theorem of seidenberg  @xcite guarantees that  @xmath62 .",
    "hence , if  @xmath63 is the normalization , there exists a holomorphic vector field in  @xmath64 mapping to  @xmath12 via  @xmath65 .",
    "this proves that normalization transforms holomorphic vector fields into holomorphic ones .",
    "let us now deal with blowups .",
    "suppose that  @xmath13 is normal at the singular point  @xmath55 and let  @xmath66 be an embedding .",
    "let  @xmath22 be a holomorphic vector field in  @xmath67 that restricts to  @xmath68 in  @xmath49 . since  @xmath13 is normal at  @xmath55",
    ", @xmath69 is an isolated singularity of  @xmath49 and must be preserved by  @xmath22 .",
    "hence , @xmath22 vanishes at the origin of  @xmath50 . upon blowing up the latter",
    ", @xmath22 extends as a holomorphic vector field to the exceptional divisor .",
    "this proves that the blowup of singular points in normal analytic surfaces transforms holomorphic vector fields into holomorphic ones .    in consequence , in zariski s resolution of  @xmath45 ,",
    "@xmath12 is transformed as a holomorphic vector field . since the minimal resolution of  @xmath45",
    "may be obtained from zariski s one by contracting exceptional curves of the first kind and since this procedure maps holomorphic vector fields to holomorphic ones , the proposition is proved .",
    "[ reducedvf ] let  @xmath70 be a germ of holomorphic vector field in the germ of normal two - dimensional analytic space  @xmath71 .",
    "a _ resolution _",
    "@xmath72 is a resolution @xmath73 and a holomorphic vector field  @xmath12 on  @xmath13 , reduced in the sense of definition  [ def : reduced ] , such that  @xmath74 .",
    "a resolution @xmath72 is said to be _",
    "minimal good _ if  @xmath44 is minimal good in the sense of definition  [ def : reduced ] .",
    "let  @xmath70 be a germ of holomorphic vector field in the germ of normal two - dimensional analytic space  @xmath71 .",
    "then it admits a minimal good resolution  @xmath72 in the sense of definition  [ reducedvf ] .    let  @xmath75 be a resolution of the analytic space .",
    "by proposition  [ desing ] , there exists a holomorphic vector field  @xmath12 on  @xmath13 such that  @xmath76 .",
    "we may , by performing finitely many blowups , make the resulting vector field on  @xmath13 reduced in the sense of definition  [ def : reduced ] and , afterwards , desingularize , if necessary , the irreducible components of  @xmath11 .",
    "if the resulting resolution is not minimal good , it may be rendered so by suitably collapsing some of the ( finitely many ) irreducible components of  @xmath11 .",
    "in open manifolds , characterizing complete holomorphic vector fields is not an easy task . in  @xcite",
    ", rebelo introduced the class of _ semicomplete _ holomorphic vector fields , a class containing complete vector fields that is , in many senses , better behaved .",
    "a holomorphic vector field  @xmath12 in a complex manifold  @xmath77 induces an ordinary differential equation in the complex domain . the existence and uniqueness theorem for such equations guarantees that for every initial condition  @xmath78 there exists some domain  @xmath79 , @xmath80 , and a map  @xmath81 solving the differential equation .",
    "the vector field is _ complete _ if for every @xmath78 we can find a solution  @xmath82 .",
    "there are essentially two ( not independent ) conditions that a vector field must fulfill in order to be complete :    * the analytic continuation of the solutions of the induced differential equation should not present multivaluedness ( this allows for each solution to be defined in a maximal subset of  @xmath17 ) . *",
    "this maximal subset of  @xmath17 must be  @xmath17 .",
    "semicomplete vector fields are those satisfying the first condition",
    ". one of their main properties is that semicomplete vector fields remain semicomplete when restricted to any open subset . in particular",
    ", it makes perfect sense to speak of _ germs _ of semicomplete vector fields , or to study semicomplete vector fields in the neighborhood of a curve , establishing local and semi - local obstructions for a vector field to be complete .",
    "+ germs of semicomplete holomorphic vector fields may be described up to biholomorphism by a list of local models , as done in  @xcite , @xcite and @xcite .",
    "semicompleteness is preserved by the bimeromorphic transformations preserving the holomorphicity of the vector field  ( * ? ? ?",
    "12 ) , and it thus makes sense to speak about local models for germs of _ reduced semicomplete _ holomorphic vector fields .",
    "these local models were reobtained and refined in  @xcite and are presented in table  [ table : combinatorics ] .",
    "+ in this table we have the local model of every reduced semicomplete vector field  @xmath12 and , for every curve invariant by  @xmath24 , the order of  @xmath12 along the curve , the ramification index of the affine structure and the camacho - sad index of  @xmath24 .",
    "we do not claim that every vector field having such a local model is semicomplete , but rather that every germ of reduced semicomplete vector field has , in convenient coordinates , one of the local models appearing in the table .",
    "let us comment briefly its contents .",
    "the first three lines correspond to points where the foliation is non - singular .",
    "the vector field may have a zero of arbitrary order along one leaf and zeros up to order two along a curve transverse to the foliation . at an _ affine regular _ point ( called simply _",
    "regular _ in  @xcite ) , the induced affine structure is non - singular ( it has ramification index equal to  @xmath41 ) .",
    "the next three lines correspond to the local models where the induced foliation has an isolated singularity , induced by a vector field with no zero eigenvalues .",
    "the _ singular non - degenerate _",
    "case corresponds to the case where the vector fields has an isolated singularity and the other two , to the cases where there are zeros of the vector field along ( at least ) one of the separatrices of the foliation .",
    "in these two cases , the ramification index of the affine structures of the separatrices is simultaneously finite or infinite . for the _ finite ramification _",
    "points , the local model is a true normal form ( in the sense that it has no inessential parameters ) and all these germs are semicomplete .",
    "furthermore , at such points , the orders of  @xmath12 over the two separatrices  @xmath83 and  @xmath84 and the ramification indices of the affine structures at their intersection point  @xmath8 satisfy the _ reciprocity relation _ @xmath85 the affine structure may be non - singular for a separatrix through a _",
    "finite ramification _ point ( the case where one of the ramification indices is equal to  @xmath41 is not excluded ) .",
    "the last line corresponds to the case where the foliation is generated by a holomorphic vector field with isolated singularity having one vanishing and one non - vanishing eigenvalue ( the _ saddle - node _ case ) .",
    "the singularity of the vector field is necessarily isolated  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* lemme  3.2 ) and semicompleteness imposes serious constrains at the level of the foliation , as established in  ( * ? ? ?",
    "4.1 ) , providing the local model appearing on the table .",
    "+        .local models of reduced holomorphic vector fields . in these , @xmath86 , @xmath87,@xmath88 and  @xmath1 is a non - vanishing holomorphic function . in the first three",
    ", the invariant curve is given by  @xmath89 . [ cols=\"^,^ \" , ]     [ exocollapse ] for the divisors  @xmath11 of example  [ exocyc ] , the divisors  @xmath90 , given by  @xmath91 , are those whose weighted dual graphs appear in figure  [ fig : contracting ] .",
    "the figure describes the ways in which the successive contraction of the exceptional curves of the first kind leads to the contraction of all of  @xmath90 . the separatrix  @xmath92 intersects the component  @xmath93 , corresponding in the figure to the leftmost vertices , and  @xmath94 .",

    "* thm .  2.14 )",
    ", the maximal reduced divisor of rational curves  @xmath95 of  @xmath96 is an _ attractor _ for the flow of  @xmath97 : every integral curve of  @xmath97 that is not contained in  @xmath95 contains  @xmath95 in its closure .",
    "we may precise further the way in which the integral curves of  @xmath97 accumulate to  @xmath95 ( see also  ( * ? ? ?",

    "let  @xmath114 .",
    "it is a manifold - with - boundary with boundary components contained in  @xmath115 and  @xmath116 .",
    "consider , within  @xmath117 , the orbit  @xmath118 of  @xmath22 given by  @xmath119 .",
    "suppose that  @xmath120 is small enough so that  @xmath118 intersects the two boundary components of  @xmath117 .",
    "close to  @xmath115 , the flow of  @xmath22 restricted to  @xmath117 is defined in the interior of round disks in  @xmath17 .",
    "close to  @xmath116 , the solutions of  @xmath22 are defined in the exterior of round disks in  @xmath17 .",
    "the parametrization of  @xmath118 induced by  @xmath22 is thus defined in a domain  @xmath121 , which is a round disk deprived of some disjoint round disks ( more than one by holonomy considerations ) .",
    "since  @xmath111 is a local biholomorphism away from  @xmath122 , it identifies the two boundary components of  @xmath117 and produces a non - compact manifold ( without boundary )  @xmath123 .",
    "this manifold has one end and embeds naturally into the kato surface  @xmath96 ( via the embedding  @xmath124 ) .",
    "its image is the complement in  @xmath96 of  @xmath95 . through this embedding",
    ", the end of  @xmath123 gets compactified by  @xmath95 .    by  ( [ presvf ] )",
    ", the identification of the boundary components of  @xmath117 will map the boundary of  @xmath118 to the boundary of  @xmath125 in such a way that , when gluing the parametrizations given by  @xmath97 , the outer boundary component of  @xmath126 is glued to one of the inner boundary components of  @xmath127 .",
    "hence , within  @xmath96 and as we approach  @xmath95 , the domain where the solution of  @xmath97 is defined contains the union  @xmath128 ( see figure  [ fig : domkato ] ) .",
    "thus , for every neighborhood  @xmath129 of  @xmath95 there exists some  @xmath130 such that the image of  @xmath131 in  @xmath96 is contained in  @xmath132 .",
    "the neighborhood  @xmath98 of  @xmath95 given by the interior of  @xmath133 has the required properties .     where the solutions of the vector field in  @xmath134 are defined , and the identification between the boundaries of these domains induced by  @xmath111 ]    let  @xmath136 be a triple satisfying the hypothesis of theorem  a. let  @xmath72 be a minimal good resolution . by theorem  [ main - local ] there is a ( blown - up ) kato surface  @xmath137 with a divisor  @xmath138 and a vector field  @xmath18 and there is a neighborhood  @xmath98 of  @xmath138 such that there is a mapping  @xmath139 ( the one guaranteed by theorem  [ main - local ] ) .",
    "we will suppose that  @xmath98 is a neighborhood like those produced by the proof of proposition  [ domainsvfkato ] .",
    "let  @xmath140 and  @xmath141 be the corresponding flows . since every integral curve of  @xmath18 that is not contained in  @xmath138 contains  @xmath138 in its closure , for each  @xmath142 there is some  @xmath143 such that  @xmath144 .",
    "define  @xmath145 as @xmath146 we claim that  @xmath147 is a biholomorphism , this is , that it is ( i )  well - defined , ( ii )  onto and  ( iii ) one - to - one . if  @xmath148 is a connected neighborhood of  @xmath149 such that  @xmath150 for every  @xmath151 then  @xmath149 and  @xmath152 define the same function in  ( [ katodiffeo ] ) . in particular , since  @xmath153 is connected ( by proposition  [ domainsvfkato ] ) , the mapping is well defined .",
    "the image of  @xmath147 is a compact set containing a neighborhood of  @xmath11 that is saturated by  @xmath24 and is thus open .",
    "hence , @xmath147 is onto .",
    "it remains to prove that  @xmath147 is one - to - one .",
    "suppose that there are two different points in  @xmath137 having the same image under  @xmath147 ( they can not belong both to  @xmath98 for  @xmath147 is one - to - one in restriction to  @xmath98 ) .",
    "if they belong to different orbits of  @xmath18 , the images of these orbits are the same one and thus there exist two orbits of  @xmath12 in restriction to  @xmath154 that get identified within  @xmath13 .",
    "but this is impossible because of the nature of the domains where the flow of  @xmath18 ( in restriction to  @xmath98 ) is defined ( proposition  [ domainsvfkato ] ) : two such domains must intersect . if the points are in the same orbit of  @xmath18 , one of the orbits of  @xmath12 has a period .",
    "however , by the description of the domains where the solution is defined ( the solution is one - to - one in arbitrarily large domains ) , no period may arise .",
    "this finishes the proof of theorem  a.    we may rephrase the passage from theorem  [ main - local ] to theorem  a in the following way : _ if  @xmath137 is an intermediate kato surface with vector field  @xmath12 and  @xmath98 is a neighborhood of the union of the rational curves in  @xmath137 then if  @xmath22 is a complete vector field on the surface  @xmath155 and  @xmath156 is an equivariant embedding , then  @xmath157 extends to a biholomorphism_. in general , given a semicomplete ( and non - complete ) holomorphic vector field  @xmath12 in some @xmath158-dimensional complex manifold  @xmath77 , there exists a _ completion of  @xmath12 _ , an @xmath158-dimensional manifold @xmath155 , a complete holomorphic vector field  @xmath22 on  @xmath155 and an equivariant embedding  @xmath159  @xcite ( there may be many of them and the manifold  @xmath155 may be non - hausdorff ) .",
    "a remarkable fact is that , in the present situation , the dynamics of the vector field on a kato surface force the uniqueness and the compactness of the completion .",
    "[ negdef ] in  [ sec - cycles ] , there remained the problem of understanding the vector fields related to the last possibility of proposition  [ propcycles ] : to understand the combinatorics that are realizable by a semicomplete vector field and , for example , to distinguish the cases where the corresponding intersection form is negative definite .",
    "theorem  [ main - local ] and its proof establish that such divisors are exactly the ones found in kato surfaces admitting vector fields . by  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* thm .  2.27 ) ,",
    "their intersection forms are negative definite .",
    "the _ hirzebruch - jung _ or _ cyclic quotient _ surface singularity  @xmath160 is the germ of analytic space obtained by taking the quotient of  @xmath9 under the linear action of  @xmath161 generated by @xmath162 for some primitive  @xmath163 root of unity  @xmath164 and some  @xmath165 such that  @xmath166 . by writing @xmath167",
    "we obtain a sequence of integers  @xmath168 .",
    "the exceptional divisor of a minimal resolution of  @xmath160 consists of  @xmath169 rational curves  @xmath170 , such that  @xmath171 , @xmath172 if  @xmath173 and @xmath174 otherwise .",
    "reciprocally , if a singularity has a resolution of this form , it is analytically equivalent to  @xmath160 , for the relatively prime integers  @xmath158 and  @xmath175 obtained from the sequence  @xmath176 via the above continued fraction  ( * ? ? ?",
    "iii ,  5 ) .",
    "+ let us proceed to the proof of theorem  b. let  @xmath177 , @xmath55 and  @xmath70 be , respectively , a stein surface , a singular point in  @xmath177 and a complete vector field on  @xmath177 like in the statement theorem  b. let  @xmath178 be a minimal good resolution .",
    "every curve invariant by  @xmath12 intersecting  @xmath11 but not contained in it ( a curve coming from a separatrix of  @xmath70 at  @xmath55 ) does so transversely at a smooth point of  @xmath11 .",
    "let  @xmath179 be a curve such that  @xmath180 is a separatrix of  @xmath70 at  @xmath55 ( such a curve exists by theorem  a ) .",
    "the restriction of  @xmath12 to the image of  @xmath30 is a vector field of the form  @xmath181 ( with  @xmath1 not identically zero by hypothesis ) .",
    "since this vector field is semicomplete , up to a reparametrization of  @xmath30 , the vector field is either of the form  @xmath182 or  @xmath183 for some  @xmath184  @xcite . in the first case",
    ", the separatrix may be parametrized by  @xmath185 and we must conclude that the orbit of  @xmath12 containing  @xmath186 has trivial stabilizer and is compactified by  @xmath20 into a rational curve within  @xmath13 which is not contained in  @xmath11 , which is impossible ( this is the only point where we use the steinness assumption on  @xmath177 ; more generally , we may suppose that  @xmath177 does not contain rational curves ) .",
    "the restriction of  @xmath12 to every separatrix is hence locally given by  @xmath183 .",
    "let  @xmath187 be an irreducible component of  @xmath11 that is not invariant by  @xmath23 .",
    "by table  [ table : combinatorics ] and the fact that  @xmath12 has no zeros near  @xmath11 that are not contained in  @xmath11 , at every point of  @xmath187 , @xmath12 is , in suitable coordinates , @xmath188 for some non - vanishing function  @xmath1 .",
    "there is thus a function  @xmath189 that gives , for each  @xmath190 , the eigenvalue of the restriction of  @xmath12 to the orbit passing through  @xmath8 . in the above local model , @xmath188 , @xmath187",
    "is given by  @xmath191 and  @xmath192 .",
    "hence , @xmath193 is constant and the flow of  @xmath12 , near  @xmath187 , has period  @xmath194 .",
    "this proves theorem  b in the case where not all irreducible components of  @xmath11 are invariant by  @xmath23 .",
    "we will henceforth assume that  @xmath11 is invariant by  @xmath23 .",
    "let  @xmath30 be a separatrix intersecting an irreducible component  @xmath83 of  @xmath11 transversely at some point  @xmath195 .",

    "notice that , for every  @xmath157 , the points of  @xmath215 other than  @xmath217 and  @xmath213 have positive ramification index . by lemma  [ notreeram ] , no separatrix or irreducible component of  @xmath11 may meet  @xmath215 at these points .",
    "if  @xmath11 reduces to ( [ chain ] ) , @xmath12 is singular non - degenerate at  @xmath216 , where it has another separatrix , and  @xmath11 is a hirzebruch - jung string . a semicomplete vector field of this kind in  @xmath160 is obtained by resolving the quotient of  @xmath218 under the action  ( [ linearcation ] ) .",
    "if  @xmath11 does not reduce to ( [ chain ] ) , there is an irreducible component  @xmath219 of  @xmath11 that intersects  @xmath220 at  @xmath216 .",
    "the vector field  @xmath12 must be a saddle - node at  @xmath216 , for  @xmath12 is holomorphic and non - identically zero along  @xmath220 .",
    "the component  @xmath219 must be a rational orbifold of order  @xmath41 and have no further singularities .",
    "the divisor  @xmath11 reduces to the hirzebruch - jung string @xmath221 . a semicomplete vector field of this kind in  @xmath160 is obtained by resolving the quotient of  @xmath222 under  ( [ linearcation ] ) .",
    "this finishes the proof of theorem  b. + in the case where the flow of the vector field factors through and action of  @xmath16 , camacho , movasati and scrdua  @xcite proved that a holomorphic action of  @xmath16 on a stein surface with a dicritical singularity is holomorphically and equivariantly equivalent to an algebraic action of  @xmath16 on an affine surface ( a case widely studied by orlik and wagreich  @xcite ) .",
    "a discussion around normal forms for the germs vector fields in  @xmath160 coming from non - degenerate ones in  @xmath9 may be found in the work of snchez - bringas  @xcite .",
    "+ theorem  b generalizes lemma  6.1 in  @xcite , which affirms that a complete vector field on a non - singular stein surface has two non - vanishing eigenvalues at an isolated equilibrium point .",
    "we will now proceed to the proof of theorem  c , by revisiting the strategy developed in  @xcite , which resorts to the local theory of semicomplete holomorphic vector fields and uses their local models up to biholomorphisms , as developed in  @xcite , @xcite and @xcite . on the one hand , our approach benefits from the proof of theorem  a , which allows one to readily recognize kato surfaces . on the other , by systematically adopting the bimeromorphic point of view , the list of local models of semicomplete vector fields becomes smaller ( we need only consider the reduced ones ) . finally , the use of the leafwise affine structure and its numerical invariants will allow us to deal more effectively with the combinatorics .",
    "+ let  @xmath12 be a holomorphic vector field on the compact complex ( not necessarily minimal ) surface  @xmath13 .",
    "if there are infinitely many compact curves tangent to  @xmath23 , the latter has a first integral by a result of jouanoulou - ghys  @xcite ( the generic level curve supports a non - identically zero vector field and is either rational or elliptic ) .",
    "we will henceforth suppose that there are only finitely many algebraic curves invariant by  @xmath23 .",
    "let  @xmath11 be the reduced divisor supported in the union of the algebraic curves invariant by  @xmath23 . blow up as many singular points of  @xmath12 as necessary so that  @xmath12 becomes _ reduced _ and  @xmath44 becomes _ minimal good _ in the sense of definition  [ def : reduced ] .",
    "all the irreducible components of  @xmath11 are non - singular curves which are either rational or elliptic ( for these are the only curves admitting uniformizable affine structures with singularities ) .",
    "furthermore , we may suppose that all the rational curves have strictly negative self - intersection for , otherwise , the surface would be either rational or ruled  ( * ? ? ?",
    "arguing like in  ( * ? ? ?",

    "we affirm that , in both cases , @xmath30 is contained in an algebraic curve . in the first case",
    ", @xmath30 is , as discussed in the previous section , contained in an algebraic ( rational ) curve . in the second case",
    ", @xmath30 is pointwise fixed by the flow of  @xmath12 in time  @xmath194 .",
    "the set of points of  @xmath13 fixed by  @xmath12 in time  @xmath194 is a closed analytic subset of  @xmath13 which is not all of  @xmath13 since  @xmath12 induces an effective action of  @xmath17 .",
    "the curve  @xmath30 is thus contained in an algebraic curve .    in particular , if  @xmath35 is an irreducible component of  @xmath11 that is not invariant by  @xmath23 , every curve intersecting it must be algebraic ( a case that has already been ruled out ) . hence , we conclude ,    * that every one - dimensional component of the locus of zeros of  @xmath12 is invariant by  @xmath23 , and * that every germ of curve invariant by  @xmath23 that intersects  @xmath11 is contained in  @xmath11 .",
    "let  @xmath95 be a connected component of  @xmath11 . if  @xmath95 contains a cycle then , by proposition  [ propcycles",

    "we will henceforth suppose that  @xmath95 has no cycles .",

    "the irreducible component  @xmath225 is necessarily a rational orbifold of type  @xmath41 carrying no further singular points of  @xmath12 .",
    "the component  @xmath83 is of type  @xmath206 , for its affine structure is induced by a non - vanishing vector field .",

    "+ our results may be used to give an alternative proof of theorem  0.1 in  @xcite , which completes the classification of minimal compact complex surfaces admitting vector fields .        ",
    " rsolution des singularits de surfaces par clatements normaliss ( multiplicit , multiplicit polaire , et singularits minimales )  , in _ trends in singularities _ , trends math . , birkhuser , basel , 2002 , p.  3181 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we prove that a singular complex surface that admits a complete holomorphic vector field that has no invariant curve through a singular point of the surface is obtained from a kato surface by contracting some divisor ( in particular , it is compact ) . </S>",
    "<S> we also prove that , in a singular stein surface endowed with a complete holomorphic vector field , a singular point of the surface where the zeros of the vector field do not accumulate is either a quasihomogeneous or a cyclic quotient singularity . </S>",
    "<S> we give new proofs of some results concerning the classification of compact complex surfaces admitting holomorphic vector fields . </S>",
    "<S> our proofs rely in a combinatorial description of the vector field on a resolution of the singular point based on previous work of rebelo and the author </S>",
    "<S> . + rsum . on prouve quun espace analytique complexe de dimension deux </S>",
    "<S> admettant un champ de vecteurs complet qui na pas de sparatrice passant par un point singulier de la surface peut sobtenir  partir dune surface de kato en effondrant un diviseur ( en particulier , lespace est compact ) . on prouve que , dans un espace analytique de stein de dimension deux muni dun champ de vecteurs complet , un point singulier de lespace qui est un point dquilibre isol du champ est soit une singularit quasi - homogne , soit une singularit de klein . </S>",
    "<S> on redmontre quelques rsultats concernant la classification des surfaces complexes compactes admettant des champs de vecteurs holomorphes . </S>",
    "<S> les preuves reposent sur des travaux rcents de rebelo et de lauteur donnant une description combinatoire des champs de vecteurs complets . </S>"
  ]
}
